title: List of North America Railway Hall of Fame inductees
data: As a Master Mechanic , he brought locomotive repairs to St. Thomas , Ontario

James A . Bell was a land surveyor , mapmaker , county engineer , and city engineer of St Thomas , Ontario . Bell was assistant engineer on the Niagara or MCR Cantilever Bridge
Manufacture of the New York Central 1290 and 1291
Steam locomotives 1290 & 1291 were constructed at the MCR Shops in St. Thomas , Ontario

An impressive structure , the Kettle Creek Bridge , was built over the Kettle Creek Valley near the western limits of St. Thomas , Ontario . It was built in the 1870s with the first train passing over in mid-1873
The Jumbo statue in St. Thomas is a magnificent monument to the death of Jumbo the Elephant of the Barnum and Bailey Circus who was killed by a train in St. Thomas , Ontario in 1885

Donald Smith helped found the Canadian Pacific Railway ( CPR . ) When the railroad was completed in 1885 , Smith was given the honour of driving the last spike at a ceremony at Craigellachie , British Columbia
Computerized Traffic Control is the used of machines and electronics/computerized equipment to regulate rail traffic
Alfred E. Perlman was the innovative president of New York Central Railroad and then the Penn Central Transportation Company
The development of the Timken Roller Bearing Axel Box was responsible for an increase in safety and efficiency
The Caboose is a multi-purpose car always positioned last on trains , and was , in many cases , replaced with sensor boxes called end-of-train devices or EOT 's
Under the control of Cornelius Vanderbilt , the MCR Niagara Cantilever Bridge was built in 1883 for $ 700,000
I 've Been Working on the Railroad
I 've Been Working on the Railroad , known to adults and children alike , was derived from the Levee Song , and has become an iconic piece of railway musical culture
